info.description:
APIs to cater for Reservation Configuration in OPERA Cloud. In this module you can retrieve, create, modify or delete configuration related to Reservations, Blocks and Leisure Management.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 23.2.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2023 Oracle and/or its affiliates.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

codeDescriptionType.description: This contains a generic code and description information.

codeType.description: Used for codes in the OPERA Code tables. Possible values of this pattern are 1, 101, 101.EQP, or 101.EQP.X.

colorType.description: Color configuration type. This color configuration provides a visual category of entities.

configCancelPenaltyType.description: The CancelPenalty class defines the cancellation policy of the hotel facility.

amountPercent.description: Cancellation fee expressed as a fixed amount, or percentage of/or room nights.

formattedRule.description: Formatted Text Rule of the Cancellation Penalty.

inactive.description: Inactive rules are no longer available for attachment to rate codes, reservation types or reservations; however, they are still recorded in the database for historical purposes.

manual.description: Flag to indicate if the cancellation policy is manual.

nonRefundable.description: Indicates if the amount is refundable if booking is canceled.

penaltyDescription.description: Text description of the Penalty in a given language.

sequence.description: The sequence number that determines the position of this rule in the Deposit or Cancellation rules LOV.

configDepositPolicyType.description: Used to define the deposit policy, guarantees policy, and/or accepted forms of payment.

amountPercent.description: Payment expressed as a fixed amount, or a percentage of/or room nights.

depositReceiptNo.description: Receipt number associated with the deposit policy

depositReqReversed.description: Flag to indicate if deposit policy is reversed

description.description: Text description of the Payment in a given language.

formattedRule.description: Formatted Text Rule of the deposit policy.

inactive.description: Inactive rules are no longer available for attachment to rate codes, reservation types or reservations; however, they are still recorded in the database for historical purposes.

manual.description: Flag to indicate if the cancellation policy is manual.

sequence.description: The sequence number that determines the position of this rule in the Deposit or Cancellation rules LOV.

transactionDate.description: Transaction Date associated with the deposit policy

typeOfCharges.description: Defines if the deposit amount is calculated based on Room Charges, Catering Charges or both

configOccupancyLevelType.description: This type holds the upsell amount by occupancy levels. This is used when upsell rule is being set bu occupancy levels

level.description: Used to specify the occupancy level id.

levelDescription.description: Used to specify the occupancy level description.

levelUpsellAmount.description: Used to specify the occupancy level upsell amount.

configOccupancyLevelsType.description: This type holds a collection of upsell amounts by occupancy levels.

configTestUpsellRuleSearchType.description: Search criteria for testing upsell rules.

adults.description: Signifies the number of adults set in the test reservation.

arrivalDate.description: Arrival date set in the test reservation.

channel.description: Signifies the channel for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

children.description: Signifies the number of children set in the test reservation.

hotelId.description: Specifies the hotel code for which the upsell rules have to be tested.

marketCode.description: Signifies the market code for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

membershipLevel.description: Signifies the membership level for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

membershipType.description: Signifies the membership type for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

nights.description: Number of nights set in the test reservation.

numberOfRooms.description: The number of rooms set in the test reservation.

occupancyLevelId.description: Signifies the occupancy level id for which the upsell rule test has to be run. This field is only available when the test upgrade rule is set for 'Upgrade By Occupancy Levels'.

rateCode.description: Signifies the rate code for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

reservationType.description: Signifies the reservation type for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

roomType.description: Signifies the room type for which the upsell rule test has to be run.

configTestUpsellRuleType.description: This gives detailed information about an upsell rule which is returned upon testing an upsell rule against a reservation.

toRoomType.description: The room type for the upsell offer.

totalStayAmount.description: The regular rate amount for the upsell offer. This amount is taken from the Rate Code configuration.

totalUpsellMoneyAmount.description: The adjusted rate amount for the room type, based on the upsell offer.

upsellRuleCode.description: Specifies the upsell rule code used for the calculation.

configTestUpsellRulesType.description: This type holds a collection of upsell rules which are returned on testing a reservation.

configUpsellRuleType.description: This gives detailed information about an upsell rule.

channels.description: This specifies the channels (e.g. Web channel or some other type of distribution channel) for which the upsell rule is applicable.

currencyCode.description: The currency code used in the upsell rule.

daysInAdvance.description: Specifies the number of days in advance of the reservation arrival date that a reservation can be upsold using this rule. So if this field is set to 10, then the reservation must be booked at least 10 days before the arrival date, in order to be eligible for the upsell.

description.description: Description gives the description for the upsell rule.

endDate.description: This represents the end date of the date range for which the upsell rule is valid.

formula.description: Signifies the formula to apply to the rule. The formula selected is used to calculate the upsell amount that is offered.

fromRoomTypeOrFromRoomClass.description: The "from" room type or room class for the upsell rule. This is the original room type/room class category.

hotelId.description: Specifies the hotel code for which the upsell rule is defined.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.
